longDef.en: how well a person, machine, etc. does a piece of work or an activity
longDef.cn: 工作情况；业绩；表现；工作性能

examples.en: He was an experienced player who was always seeking to improve his performance.
examples.cn: 他是一名有经验的选手，不断寻求提高自己的技能。

examples.en: High-performance cars (= those that are fast, powerful, and easy to control) are the most expensive.
examples.cn: 性能卓越的车价格最高。

examples.en: This was a very impressive performance by the young player, who scored 14 points within the first ten minutes.
examples.cn: 那位年轻球员的表现十分出色，在开场10分钟内就得了14分。

longDef.en: the action of entertaining other people by dancing, singing, acting, or playing music

examples.en: a performance of Arthur Miller's play "The Crucible"
examples.cn: 上演的阿瑟•米勒的戏剧《炼狱》

examples.en: She gave a superb performance as Lady Macbeth.
examples.cn: 她出色地扮演了麦克白夫人。

longDef.en: an action or type of behaviour that involves a lot of attention to detail or to small matters that are not important

examples.en: Cleaning the oven is such a performance.
examples.cn: 清理烤箱真是一件苦差。

examples.en: What a performance! Please stop shouting!
examples.cn: 像什么样子！请别再大喊大叫了！

examples.en: The fish pie is a bit of a performance to make.
We managed to assemble the bookshelves eventually, but it was a real performance.
We had such a performance getting the new sofa into the house.

longDef.en: an occasion when an event or a situation happens again:
longDef.cn: 警察希望避免去年庆典变成暴乱的事件再次发生。

examples.en: The police hope to avoid a repeat performance of last year, when the festivities turned into rioting.
examples.cn: 警察希望避免去年庆典变成暴乱的事件再次发生。
